title: The Great AngularJS Mystery
author: John Doe
description: A tale of suspense and confusion about a developer finding out the truth of why AngularJS was scraped.

title: Unforgivable Coding Crimes
author: Miran Delly
description: Some of the most surprising, heinous, and unforgivable code released on the market, and the catastrophes they have or could have released

title: Where Did All the Donuts Go
author: Jan Baker
description: The crime of not getting a donut during donut day at the office drive an employee to start a secret donut shop.... in the break room.

title: The Processing Cap
author: Susane Roe
description: Making faster processors is getting harder, and the market for buying new computers is slowing down. Companies are getting desperate to sell new products, but how far will they go?

title: Floppy Disks
author: Iam Holdt
description: A villian has uploaded a database of life saving information onto many many many floppy disks. Can the team load the disks quickly enough before the disks expire?

title: Bandwidth Stealer
author: Rex Malton
description: Someone in the office is taking all the bandwidth and watching videos. No one can get their work done.  Who is doing it?

title: Ironic Ionic
author: John Doe
description: A team is tasked with making prokects in Ionic,  but their competitor seems to keep beatingthem on deadlines using React Native. Is there a spy working for the competitor?

title: The Scrum Master
author: Harry Hendrix
description: Gather around the conference table,  we're about to have our morning Scrum!.

title: Another Book Title
author: Eric Wang
description: I blanked out on an idea for this book. I knew I wanted it to be expensive though.

title: Six Year Fear
author: Ezra Jolel
description: Every six years,  the tech industry goes through a change of skills that changes it's approach and performance. Can developers survive it?
